item.title: Finding the Sum of a Geometric Sequence
item.description: Formula Given a geometric sequence $a_{n} = a r^{n-1}$ with the first term $a$ and common ratio $r$, $$ \sum_{k=1}^{n} a_{k}= {{a (1- r^{n} ) } \over {1-r}} $$ Proof Let’s denote it as $\displaystyle S= \sum_{k=1}^{n} a_{k}$. Then, $$ S= a + ar + \cdots + ar^{n-2} + ar^{n-1} $$ Multiplying both sides by $r$ gives $$ rS= ar + a r^2 + \cdots + ar^{n-1} + ar^{n} $$
